nodes.bodyText: Is this really necessary? I think appArtifact would normally represent the app root. Except when a test actually creates a project in a tmp dir.
I don't think this should be required. Is there an actual reason for setting the project root and the app root?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -132,6 +132,8 @@ public void execute() throws MojoExecutionException {
             try (CuratedApplication curatedApplication = QuarkusBootstrap
                     .builder()
                     .setAppArtifact(appArtifact)
+                    .setApplicationRoot(classesDir)
+                    .setProjectRoot(project.getBasedir().toPath())

nodes.bodyText: Why would you want to require that? I think in most cases appArtifact would represent the app root anyway.

nodes.bodyText: I'll need to check whether it's safe to assume the file is always available and exists.
